txt.en: This scavenger hunt card has a list of things to find. They could be anywhere!
If Butterbur forgets to send this letter promptly, I shall roast him!
Year 9 Tales: Gandalf
Find Gandalf the White in Fangorn
Read from the Chronicle of Events and complete The Wizard's Vale
Cards hang from the Party Tree. Each card contains a scavenger hunt to complete at your own pace.
You completed a scavenger hunt card!
<rgb=#FF00FF>Pat</rgb> Shadowfax in the High Stables in Minas Tirith
Set off fireworks by the Party Tree
'Gandalf! I have been seeking you. I have an urgent errand, and my news is evil.'\n\nThen he whispered: 'Nazgûl.'
These doors were no secret. In the days of Durin, they usually stood open, and any who knew the opening word could pass in.
<rgb=#FF00FF>Shake your fist</rgb> before the throne in Meduseld
Completed scavenger hunt card.
Talk with Radgast the Brown in Agamaur
A great bundle of fireworks of all sorts and shapes, each labelled with a large red G - for Grand, the hobbit children believed.
DNT WIZARD'S VALE SESSION
Radagast was master of changes of shape and hue and of lore regarding herbs, beast, and birds
Gather remembrances around Zirakzigil, the Endless Stair, and the Bridge of Khazad-dûm ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Completed
DNT fireworks

Every year in the spring, the Anniversary Scavenger Hunt takes place to celebrate a very special occasion.\n\n<rgb=#FF0000> NOTE: This quest will be removed from your quest log when the current festival ends. </rgb>
<rgb=#FF00FF>Scold</rgb> Barliman Butterbur in the Prancing Pony
<rgb=#FF00FF>Meditate</rgb> at Hollin Gate before Moria
Complete the Ford of Bruinen Skirmish
You recall adventures past ([placeholder]/[placeholder])

'My name! Have you not guessed it? You have heard it before... yes, you have heard it before. 

'You may still call me Gandalf, though I am white now. So you might say I am Saruman, at least as he should have been.'

And he laughed heartily.

'But be merry, for we meet at the turning of the tide. The great storm is coming, but the tide has turned!'
Hearken, Théoden son of Thengel. Not all is dark. Too long you have sat in the shadows and trusted to twisted tales.
You turn the pages and become immersed in the chronicle of 'The Wizard's Vale.'
You do not ride Shadowfax - either he is willing to carry you or not.
